main_definition: A visible mass of air containing tiny water droplets or ice crystals suspended in the atmosphere, which can also refer to a collection of data stored remotely over the internet.

meanings_and_examples.definition: a temporary state of confusion or lack of clarity
meanings_and_examples.example: After being told bad news, her thoughts were all in a cloud.

meanings_and_examples.definition: an obstacle or difficulty that makes it hard to understand something
meanings_and_examples.example: The technical jargon was like a thick cloud of confusion for the new employees.

meanings_and_examples.definition: a group of objects, particularly in astronomy
meanings_and_examples.example: The Milky Way is one part of our local group of galaxies, which also includes several other large clouds of stars and planets.

meanings_and_examples.definition: data stored on remote servers accessed via the internet
meanings_and_examples.example: I'm working on my report using cloud storage to access documents from various locations.
